title: Portfolio perspectives: Positioning for a regime of higher volatility
abstract: Our updated CMAs and strategic views are positioned for a new regime of greater macroeconomic and market volatility.

title: Portfolio perspectives: Still stocks over bonds, but the gap narrows
abstract: 2022 has seen big market moves. We stick to our strategic views preferring stocks over nominal government bonds. Read why in our latest Portfolio perspectives.

title: Navigating the new market regime
abstract: Much has changed since our Q1 2022 outlook - a war, energy shock and the Federal Reserve’s pivot on monetary policy. We stay underweight bonds, even as yields have sprinted upward, and overweight equities. Read more in our Q2 2022 Global Outlook.

title: Russia invades Ukraine
abstract: We see Russia’s invasion of Ukraine as the start of protracted tensions between Russia and the West. What are the investment implications? Read our insights.

title: Portfolio perspectives: Confusion yields opportunity
abstract: Amid the market confusion so far this year, we see an opportunity to add to our overweight to developed market equities on a strategic horizon. Read why.

title: Portfolio perspectives: What could go wrong?
abstract: We assess how different the path of interest rates and the outlook on China would need to be to challenge our asset views

title: How to finance the net-zero transition in emerging markets
abstract: Countries have a stake in avoiding mounting climate risk, but emerging markets will play a key role in the net-zero transition. Dive deeper in this featured insight from the BlackRock Investment Institute.

title: Portfolio perspectives: Getting granular
abstract: Our overweight on developed market equities is further bolstered by a more granular, sectoral approach. Learn more in the August 2021 Portfolio perspectives.

title: In depth: The new nominal: just getting started
abstract: The interplay between monetary and fiscal policy has dominated the post-Covid macro environment. Read more on how it informs our strategic investment views.

title: In depth: The case for Chinese assets
abstract: China’s economy and capital markets have rapidly grown to become the 2nd largest in the world, yet foreign investors own just 3% of its equities and bonds. Read more.

title: Launching climate-aware portfolios
abstract: We believe climate risk is investment risk. That is why we are incorporating it into our portfolio design, as part of a series of actions BlackRock is taking to prepare for a net-zero world.

title: Turning risk into opportunity
abstract: Read our in-depth paper exploring how we incorporate climate change into our portfolio design - one step in a series of actions BlackRock is taking to prepare for a net-zero world.

title: A new investment order
abstract: Explore our updated our asset views in light of market developments. The BlackRock Investment Institute also explores the fiscal debate.

title: Davos brief
abstract: Our new Davos brief presents a snapshot of BII’s latest views on the macro outlook, geopolitics and markets – as global leaders debate the state of the world through the digital “Davos Dialogues.”

title: U.S. election: Biden win
abstract: In the wake of a contest between starkly different visions for America, the BlackRock Investment Institute explores the implications of the U.S. election.

title: Portfolio construction
abstract: Explore the portfolio construction research behind BlackRock's modern framework for strategic asset allocation and building resilient investor-specific portfolios.

title: Readying for resilience
abstract: Read about how we revamp our strategic asset preferences to position for market dislocations and the post-Covid 19 world.

title: Troubled waters
abstract: What would the world look like with less water? We explore the often overlooked risk of water stress and its financial implications on portfolios. Take a look.

title: Webcast: Midyear investment outlook
abstract: Please join us for a video webcast with BII leadership and BlackRock senior investors as they discuss the 2020 midyear investment outlook.

title: Historic U.S. policy actions
abstract: The U.S. announced a historic policy stimulus package to help stymie the economic impact from the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Sizable policy action takes shape
abstract: We could return with limited permanent economic damage if authorities deliver a policy response to support through the shock.

title: Market plunge: This is not 2008
abstract: Market moves have been reminiscent of the financial crisis, but the economy and financial system are on stronger footing.

title: Time for policy to go direct
abstract: A coordinated policy response to the coronavirus shock is needed to avoid persistent economic damage.

title: Sustainability: The tectonic shift transforming investing
abstract: A commonly held view is that a return sacrifice is needed when adopting sustainable investing. We disagree – and in fact believe the opposite is true.

title: Coronavirus warrants caution
abstract: We are reducing our overweight equity and credit exposures due to coronavirus outbreaks but maintain benchmark holdings.

title: How will geopolitics impact markets in 2020?
abstract: BlackRock experts discuss the primary risks we see facing investors.

title: Davos brief
abstract: The global economic expansion is stretching, but powerful structural trends are testing limits — and intersecting with the near-term outlook.

title: Sustainability: The bond that endures
abstract: Evidence is building that a focus on sustainability can help investors build more resilient portfolios.

title: Emerging markets: investor allocation
abstract: Amer Bisat and Karen Leiton engage the issue of “what is the optimal emerging markets allocation,” using three critical lenses to provide insight on the topic.

title: Taking stock: Q3 2022 equity market outlook
abstract: What to do in equity portfolios at the midyear point? Fundamental Equities CIO Tony DeSpirito assesses the backdrop and identifies three favored sectors.

title: Seeking resilience: 2022 Midyear Credit Outlook
abstract: BlackRock’s 2022 Global Credit Midyear Outlook looks at issues impacting credit markets this year across public and private credit.

title: Fundamental Equities
abstract: BlackRock Fundamental Equities (FE) is a world-class active investing organization committed to applying our Expert Insight to power our portfolios.

title: 2022 Midyear Global Outlook
abstract: We are braving a new world of heightened macro and market volatility. How should clients position their portfolios? Read our midyear investment outlook.

title: Staying calm amid market volatility
abstract: Periods of volatility like we’ve seen recently aren’t easy to live through. We hope our checklist for long-term investors will help you weather the storm.

title: Prepping for a Financial Hurricane
abstract: Rick Rieder examines the causes of today’s financial conditions and shares his outlook for the economy and how to position fixed income portfolios.

title: Advantages of Private Equity Coinvestments
abstract: We lay out the potential benefits of co-investments along with the historical success and growth of the co-investment industry.

title: Constructing Optimized Private Equity Programs
abstract: We lay out differences between diversified private equity programs investing in primaries, secondaries and co-investments.

title: Sizing up inflation
abstract: BlackRock’s inflation hub features our latest market insights and investment recommendations concerning post-pandemic inflationary trends. Explore more.

title: The inflation challenge of an aging world
abstract: Many factors may be contributing to inflation, but one structural cause could be an aging population. BlackRock’s Global CIO of Multi-Asset Solutions examines the demographic drivers of inflation and ways to position portfolios.

title: An equity investor’s guide to inflation
abstract: Inflation is likely to fall from peak levels but settle higher than recent memory. Tony DeSpirito looks at stock impacts across growth, value and sectors.

title: Rieder- Making Sense of Uncertainty in Markets
abstract: Every one of the ugliest, headline-grabbing “if, then” scenarios for the global economy and markets has reasonable odds of going the other way to create a rather benign outcome.

title: Commodities in demand
abstract: Heightened geopolitical and inflationary pressures this year have put a spotlight on how investors use for a dual purpose: a potential hedge against inflation and adding portfolio diversification in a rising rate environment.

title: Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act
abstract: In this Real Assets viewpoint, explore key takeaways for investors from the Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act, including where private capital can come in to complement public spending.

title: Navigating geopolitical uncertainty
abstract: Explore BlackRock’s geopolitical hub, featuring insights on the Ukraine crisis and its potential impact on global economies, markets, and investors.

title: A stagflationary shock
abstract: The geopolitical crisis in Ukraine creates a stagflationary shock for global economies and fighting inflation just got more complex for global central banks. Read more in the spring 2022 Systematic Fixed Income Outlook.

title: Building for growth
abstract: Senator Rob Portman, Dow CEO Jim Fitterling and BlackRock investors discuss infrastructure modernization’s impact on economic opportunities and portfolio implications. Explore the replays from our BlackRock Future Forum infrastructure special.

title: Accelerants of growth: Fiscal spend and policy Q&A with Rick Rieder
abstract: What is the path for fiscal and monetary policy in 2022? Rick Rieder discusses his outlook and explains why demand for fixed income will continue to exceed expectations, holding yields in check even amid historically high inflation.

title: What lies ahead for fiscal spending and monetary policy?
abstract: BlackRock’s fiscal spending and monetary policy hub features our latest insights on the impact of government fiscal spending and monetary policies on the macroeconomic landscape, markets, and specific asset classes.

title: Resilience and adaptation
abstract: As investors seek to navigate an unprecedented market regime, we see private market investments as well-suited to the task. Read more in the 2022 Private Markets Outlook.

title: U.S. investors should help fix our infrastructure
abstract: Zach Buchwald, head of USCA Institutional Business, gives his insight on the state of U.S. infrastructure and the opportunities that investors may have to help.

title: Taking stock: Q1 2022 equity market outlook
abstract: What might equity investors expect in 2022? Active stock picker Tony DeSpirito reviews the potential positives and impediments in his Q1 market outlook.

title: It’s not the 1970s again: A comparison of markets
abstract: Rick Rieder and team examine the parallels, or lack of them, between the economy, markets and policy of the 1970s and today.

title: How the Paris Agreement is shaping equity investing
abstract: The 2015 Paris Agreement sets a global standard for preventing climate change. Learn how it’s changing the way equity investors uncover alpha today.

title: A multi-asset approach to navigating net zero
abstract: In this featured insight, we focus on the practical implications of moving from climate pledges to practice for multi-asset investors by sharing our preferred framework.

title: There’s more than an underwater beach ball in today’s investment pool
abstract: In this insight, Rick Rieder and team examine the myriad investment opportunities that are available in an environment dominated by negative real interest rates.

title: Building inflation-resilient portfolios
abstract: Today’s inflation and market environment calls for a thoughtful, whole portfolio approach to meeting client’s objectives. Diversification and dynamism may help, which we explore in our latest insight.

title: New developments in quantitative investing
abstract: Quantitative pioneers Ronald Kahn and Richard Grinold share their views on the evolution of quantitative investing and recent advances in portfolio management.

title: Inflation and real assets
abstract: Read why real assets may perform well in periods of higher inflation and which strategies real assets investors should deploy in a higher inflationary environment.

title: Higher inflation: turning threat into opportunity
abstract: Due to a combination of strong demand as many economies restart post COVID lockdowns and widespread supply bottlenecks, inflation has been surging in many parts of the world. How can we prepare for inflationary outcomes in a whole portfolio context?

title: Global Impact Annual Report
abstract: Our report captures the reality of the challenges we face amid the ongoing global pandemic as well as the resilient responses that many impact enterprises offer as solutions. Explore more in BlackRock’s inaugural Global Impact Annual Report.

title: Q2 2021 OIG digest
abstract: As we close out the first half of 2021, investors are becoming increasingly concerned over inflation and the delta variant, while sustainability remains top of mind for global official institutions. Read more about our outlook and key trends.

title: Is it too late to invest in healthcare and tech?
abstract: Recent weeks have seen volatility in equity markets, and particularly bumpy performance for tech and healthcare. Is the run-up of these star sectors coming to a halt as the post-pandemic era sets in? We do not think so.

title: Addressing the US$23 trillion dragon in the room
abstract: In 2020, China’s onshore equity and bond markets combined to be over US$23 trillion in assets, but China remains a small fraction of most investor portfolios. We explore more in our Q&A.

title: Impact investing in public equities
abstract: Impact investing in public equities can help accomplish two objectives: generate financial outperformance and provide a differentiated source of alpha. Read more in our report.

title: The growing opportunity in China’s private markets
abstract: In this blog, we explore the potential of private financing arrangements and why global investors are looking to put capital to work in Chinese markets.

title: Private equity: finding the informational advantage
abstract: Using alternative data in private equity has the potential to revolutionize deal sourcing and improve the probability of investment success in private markets.

title: A dynamic restart
abstract: We examine the state of play in global credit at midyear, tracking progress on our 2021 themes and re-underwriting their relevance going forward.

title: Opportunities for yield and income in China
abstract: We explore what’s driving Chinese fixed income markets and how investors can benefit from higher yields and diversification across the credit and duration spectrum.

title: Expanding the real assets toolkit
abstract: Leveraging the full spectrum of real asset investments may be key to capitalizing on cyclical recovery opportunities. Learn more across three asset classes: infrastructure equity, infrastructure debt, and listed real assets.

title: Credit’s next chapter
abstract: Amid easy financial conditions but rapid change, we see credit markets creating more options for companies seeking financing and for investors seeking yield.

title: A range of Covid trajectories in emerging markets
abstract: The pandemic has hit each country in unique ways. Understanding the local and global investment implications takes deep, country-by-country analysis.

title: Invest with impact
abstract: Our paper supports impact investing in public equities by reference to additionality through the investor’s contribution, the investee, and the asset class.

title: Delivering outcomes by accessing ESG
abstract: We outline our belief that incorporating ESG insights can improve investment outcome. This can be done through our index, factor, and alpha framework.

title: Thematic investing in the time of Coronavirus
abstract: The Coronavirus pandemic has ushered in countless changes in our daily lives. We see opportunities to capitalize on these changes through thematic investing.

title: The pandemic and the credit spectrum
abstract: Credit markets are strong. But behind the headlines, a more complex story is unfolding as long-running trends intersect with Covid’s economic consequences.

title: Optimizing private market portfolios
abstract: Today’s larger, more diverse private-asset allocations call for quantitative portfolio construction techniques. In this webcast, BlackRock senior investors and researchers will discuss a new framework for optimizing private markets portfolios.

title: Private market opportunities in China
abstract: Join our investors for an overview of China's dynamic private markets and drill-down into the local opportunity sets.

title: Optimizing private markets portfolios
abstract: Investors with larger, more diverse allocations to private assets need greater precision in portfolio construction. Data science techniques can help.

title: LDI in a rising rate environment
abstract: How have corporate pensions been responding to rising rates, and how should we think about LDI in a rising rate world?

title: BlackRock sector outlook 2021: Healthcare
abstract: The pandemic put the healthcare sector front and center in 2020 and 2021 as development of therapies and vaccines to combat COVID-19 got underway.

title: A lens on emerging market equities
abstract: Emerging market (EM) equities defied early gloom last year and ended with double -digit gains, outperforming developed markets.

title: Sourcing deals in today's private markets
abstract: Join us for insights into global deal flow and our views on effective sourcing in today’s private credit, private equity and real asset markets

title: Private markets 2021: Staying on track in a world of change
abstract: An integrated view of private markets has never been more important. Explore highlights from our start-of-the-year webcast, with investors looking at deployment, investment themes and possible surprises in real assets, credit and private equity.

title: Real assets in the year ahead
abstract: Read our 2021 Global Real Assets Outlook for insights into how real estate and infrastructure investors can pursue their goals amid deep structural changes and an uneven global recovery.

title: What we expect in credit markets
abstract: Credit markets are seeing greater demand in a low yield world. In our 2021 Global Credit Outlook, we offer investors three themes to steer by as they navigate public and private credit markets in the year ahead.

title: Private markets 2021 webcast
abstract: Join us for our views on how 2021 may unfold across the private markets spectrum, with insights on opportunities in real assets, credit and private equity.

title: ESG moves centre stage in private debt
abstract: Private debt strategies can work with borrowers on ESG issues. Sonia Richer, Head of Research for European Middle Market Private Debt, explains how.

title: Emerging markets in the spotlight
abstract: BlackRock’s leading emerging market investors explain why they are bullish on EM in 2021 and where they see the best opportunities in equity and debt.

title: A different kind of distressed-credit cycle
abstract: The pandemic is likely to drive a significant wave of restructuring that calls for a broader range of solutions than seen in prior cycles.

title: 2020: A Year of BifurKation
abstract: An increasing body of evidence suggests the economic recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic is K-shaped – implying a distinct bifurcation of outcomes.

title: New perspectives on macro investing
abstract: BlackRock’s systematic team explains how using big data and machine learning can produce differentiated macro insights, and why these insights are especially relevant in the current climate.

title: The evolution of private equity
abstract: We explore the historical evolution and outperformance of private equity over the last four decades and the outlook for the next decade.

title: Fixed income style factors
abstract: The fundamental investment concepts underlying style factor investing can be applied in fixed income.

title: Global Credit Forum
abstract: Explore the on-demand content from our virtual Global Credit Forum in September 2020, where BlackRock leaders were joined by industry experts.

title: New perspectives on macro investing
abstract: In today’s fast-changing market, a proper understanding of the macroeconomic environment is essential to investing.

title: GTAA: An overlooked driver of performance
abstract: We explore the uncorrelated return profile and application of alternative data in our GTAA investment framework.

title: Navigating the beta gap
abstract: Learn how multi-asset strategies deliver investment outcomes with more precision.

title: Low risk, low inflation, low growth
abstract: Risk parity is well-positioned for a low rate, low inflation and low-growth environment.

title: Sustainable investing: active equities
abstract: Sustainable investing is going mainstream. The Systematic Active Equity team discusses the need to dig beyond headline numbers.

title: Technology: Our new virtual reality
abstract: A discussion on trends that are reshaping the tech industry, where we see opportunities today, and what breakthrough technologies may shape our future.

title: The renewable revolution
abstract: A look at how the world will power its energy needs in the future and where structural transformation is leading to investment opportunities.

title: Investing for income
abstract: We examine multiple opportunities to generate much-needed income in a world where benchmark interest rates are pegged near zero for the foreseeable future.

title: Healthcare in the age of the coronavirus
abstract: Healthcare leaders explore how the efforts to combat the coronavirus are progressing, how technology is impacting the industry, and the future of healthcare.

title: Assessing opportunities across private markets
abstract: Our panelists share insights on how they are positioning private markets portfolios for both near-term opportunities and long-term resilience.

title: Fortifying portfolios for the next crisis
abstract: The current crisis tested both portfolio construction and market liquidity. We examine the lessons learned and share insights on preparing for more volatility.

title: Winds of change: How to invest in renewables today
abstract: We explore how to invest in renewables today as well as the role of this asset class in a total portfolio.

title: A credit cycle like no other
abstract: In a credit market transformed by Covid-19 and record stimulus, we explore investment opportunities amid significant sector dispersion and a likely wave of distress.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: U.S. BBB bonds and fallen angels
abstract: We provide an update to our August 2019 spotlight on US BBB Bonds in light of the first broad credit downgrade cycle resulting from COVID-19 and lower oil prices.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: Fixed income index rebalancing
abstract: We discuss how decisions to delay fixed income index rebalancing during March 2020 helped to preserve market liquidity, prevent unnecessarily large transaction costs for end-investors, and more.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: European BBB bonds and fallen angels
abstract: In this Policy Spotlight, we provide an update to our August 2019 spotlight on US BBB Bonds in light of the first broad credit downgrade cycle resulting from COVID-19 and lower oil prices.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: U.S. municipal bond market
abstract: We explore aspects of the U.S. municipal bond market ecosystem during the COVID-19 Crisis, the Federal response to provide assistance to municipalities, and liquidity risk management of municipal bond funds.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: ETFs as a source of stability
abstract: We explore how ETFs were a source of stability during the first part of 2020 amidst unprecedented market volatility by providing price transparency and liquidity.

title: Private perspectives on healthcare opportunities
abstract: COVID is driving big changes in global healthcare, creating both winners and losers. In this setting, private debt and equity can be effective ways to invest.

title: Credit downgrades and fallen angels
abstract: We explore the current credit downgrade landscape and look at two different ways to navigate credit markets given this new environment.

title: Private equity secondaries: Four things to know now
abstract: As periods of market stress roll on, opportunities to buy secondary interests in private funds may grow. Here are the deals and discounts our team is seeing.

abstract: As the diverse economies of Asia-Pacific emerge from their Covid-19 lockdowns, multiple dynamics are driving markets.

title: Optimized private equity programs
abstract: We lay out the differences between diversified private equity programs investing in primaries, secondaries and co-investments.

title: Private capital’s role in post-Covid healthcare
abstract: The Covid-19 crisis is significantly impacting the healthcare industry, intensifying the focus of private market investors.

title: Accelerating sustainability in alternatives
abstract: Sustainability factors are even more important in long-term private investments—a point that COVID is underlining.

title: Re-assessing private markets portfolios
abstract: Our investors share their latest thoughts on liquidity, rebalancing, and where we see opportunities in private markets.

title: Direct lending's next chapter
abstract: Markets have shifted, but there’s still a cohort of resilient, middle-market companies that need private capital.

title: The evolving picture in private equity
abstract: The initial shock of the pandemic brought upon questions about valuations, capital calls, liquidity needs and secondaries.

title: Accelerating sustainability
abstract: Join our experts for a discussion of why ESG is likely to matter more than ever as the COVID crisis eases.

title: Today’s alternatives landscape
abstract: Private markets shifted significantly amid the COVID shock, underscoring the value of thoughtful, risk-managed portfolio design.

title: Rethinking risk and rebalancing portfolios
abstract: We examine approaches to assessing total portfolio risk and discuss opportunities for clients that are rebalancing.

title: The dynamic opportunity set in credit
abstract: BlackRock’s credit sector experts as they discuss what they’re seeing across public and private markets

title: Renewables are proving resilient
abstract: How well-structured deals and the ongoing global energy transition can benefit wind and solar investments in the current downturn.

title: Assessing portfolio risk and optimizing rebalancing strategies
abstract: We discuss approaches to assessing risk across the total portfolio, including public and private markets.

title: What’s ahead in APAC real estate?
abstract: BlackRock’s Head of APAC real estate discusses Asia’s property markets in the wake of COVID-19.

abstract: Join us as we discuss private markets and the implications for outcome-based portfolio construction.

title: Multi-asset perspectives on the crisis
abstract: Our investors share their views on macro themes in today’s markets, portfolio positioning and traditional assumptions.

title: Inspecting infrastructure
abstract: Join us as we discuss the pandemic and its economic fallout impacting global infrastructure markets.

title: Capitalizing on equity market dislocation
abstract: During this call, our investors will discuss how market dislocation is creating both short- and long-term opportunities in equities.

title: Why private equity secondaries may soon pick up
abstract: Why we’re likely to see a significant increase in private equity secondary market transactions in the months ahead.

title: BlackRock raises US$5.1B for GEPIF III
abstract: Infrastructure fund close marks the largest alternative asset fundraise in BlackRock history.

title: Windows on real estate
abstract: Join our investors for views across regions and up and down the real-estate capital stack.

title: Finding long-term value in short-term turmoil
abstract: How can investors allocate risk and stay focused on the long term while confronting tremendous short-term disruptions?

title: Opportunities and risks in credit markets
abstract: We discuss opportunities and risks developing in credit markets amid historic volatility and unprecedented monetary policy.

title: Navigating an uneven road to recovery
abstract: As the world plots its emergence from coronavirus closures, the pace of recovery and prospective outcomes look diverse.

title: Hedge funds through the downturn
abstract: Join us as we discuss how the hedge fund industry faring in today’s volatile markets.

title: Rebalancing and tactical opportunities
abstract: BlackRock’s insights on the risks that may be hidden in institutional portfolios and thoughts on how to rebalance amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Private equity in a changed landscape
abstract: Join BlackRock private equity investors for an update on keeping programs on track and alert to opportunities.

title: Assessing liquidity and opportunity in fixed income
abstract: Rick Rieder offers insights on how fixed income markets are functioning and where he sees opportunity.

title: Private markets: The view from a CIO’s dashboard
abstract: Our leaders discuss the challenges and opportunities facing private market investors amid current turmoil.

title: Current dynamics in credit markets
abstract: A look at the profound shifts in macroeconomics and geopolitics that have transpired as of late as well as thoughts on the imminent US election.

title: Private markets in a time of turbulence
abstract: Alternative investors share perspectives on how the COVID-19 pandemic is playing out across the private markets.

title: US IG Credit Outlook Q1 2020
abstract: We discuss the start of 2020, evolving investment themes, M&A trends and ESG as an alpha driver.

title: Private markets 2020
abstract: Our guide to private markets offers a timely analysis of 13 distinct asset classes organized by three common outcomes.

title: Getting precise in private markets
abstract: Institutional investors are increasingly looking to private markets to meet their most important objectives.

title: Global credit outlook
abstract: We expect returns in 2020 to be closer to the average coupon of the market, but with greater underlying dispersion.

title: Q1 2020: Decoding the markets
abstract: Leaders of BlackRock’s Systematic Active Equity Platform leverage +10 years investment in big data and machine learning to provide a unique perspective on markets.

abstract: BlackRock examines key themes for investors in 2020: a slowing cycle, accelerating change and the relative attractiveness of the asset class.

title: Q&A: Private debt in transition?
abstract: We explore what shape the European private debt market will take and the trends to watch in the medium term.

title: Alternative investments in modern portfolios
abstract: Over the past 25 years or so, alternatives have evolved from a small part of the portfolios into a core holding.

title: Bonds as ballast
abstract: Read about why we think stubbornly low interest rates challenge long-held assumptions about the role government bonds play in strategic asset allocations.

title: Investing in healthcare stocks
abstract: COVID-19 has dominated healthcare conversations for two years. Equity investor Erin Xie explores the broader landscape and opportunities post-pandemic.

title: Global Healthcare Outlook 2022
abstract: The pandemic put the healthcare sector front and center in 2020 and 2021 as development of therapies and vaccines to combat COVID-19 got underway.

title: Key investment themes for Healthcare CFOs
abstract: As we embark on Healthcare’s next chapter, we share key learnings from the pandemic for CFOs to consider as they navigate the path forward.

title: Investing in floating rates: Preparing for a rising rate regime
abstract: In this credit insight, we compare the characteristics of different floating rate investments as an alternative to rate sensitive fixed income.

title: Insurers embrace risk: Exploring BlackRock’s Global Insurance Report
abstract: The International Insurance Society and BlackRock co-hosted a webinar to discuss key themes from BlackRock’s 2021 Global Insurance Report. Explore the recap.

title: Investment implications of COP26
abstract: COP26 brought tens of thousands of public officials, corporate leaders, and climate activists to chart a path to limiting global warming. BlackRock experts discussed where they see both investment risks and opportunities coming out of the conference.

title: Key themes for corporate pensions in 2022
abstract: In our fourth annual corporate pension themes publication, we encourage all U.S. corporate plans to begin thinking beyond fully funded across four dimensions: glidepath design, portfolio construction, implementation, and end-game solutions.

title: Q4 2021 OIG Digest
abstract: As 2021 draws to a close, we round up the key trends and themes that have shaped the Official Institutions investing landscape over the course of the year – and highlight some insights on what might be in store for 2022.

title: Insurance Leaders Symposium 2021: Resilience through innovation
abstract: Watch on-demand content from the 2021 Insurance Leaders Symposium, which featured senior BlackRock thought leaders and influential industry voices convening to explore the “new normal” for insurers.

title: Global Insurance Report 2021: Insurers embrace risk
abstract: Against the backdrop of an increasing risk appetite, global insurers share their views on growing allocations to non-core assets, their increased focus on sustainability and accelerating advances in technology.

title: What’s in store for emerging markets?
abstract: Emerging markets have had a challenging year as vaccine rollouts have lagged and economic reopening has been delayed, particular in comparison to developed markets counterparts. This paper explores what is next for EM investors.

title: How to save America’s retirement dream
abstract: Zach Buchwald, head of USCA Institutional Business, and Anne Ackerley, head of the Retirement Group, give their insight on the future of America’s retirement in this featured piece, originally published in Newsweek.

title: Corporate pensions: Improving funding ratios, but still hard at work
abstract: In our latest corporate pensions peer study, BlackRock examines dispersions and how plans can align their investment strategy with their end-state objectives.

title: What is the value of tax management in legacy portfolios?
abstract: In this featured insight, we highlight research from Aperio which analyzes the tax benefits achieved in legacy portfolios at inception and thereafter.

title: Higher inflation: turning threat into opportunity
abstract: Due to a combination of strong demand as many economies restart post COVID lockdowns and widespread supply bottlenecks, inflation has been surging in many parts of the world. How can we prepare for inflationary outcomes in a whole portfolio context?

title: Q2 2021 OIG digest
abstract: As we close out the first half of 2021, investors are becoming increasingly concerned over inflation and the delta variant, while sustainability remains top of mind for global official institutions. Read more about our outlook and key trends.

title: Is it too late to invest in healthcare and tech?
abstract: Recent weeks have seen volatility in equity markets, and particularly bumpy performance for tech and healthcare. Is the run-up of these star sectors coming to a halt as the post-pandemic era sets in? We do not think so.

title: Public pensions, post pandemic
abstract: The BlackRock Client Insight Unit analyzed data of more than 85 U.S. public pensions to understand the impact of the pandemic downturn and other extreme market events. Read more in our peer study.

title: Trickle to main stream - Central banks’ journey into sustainability
abstract: This paper examines how climate change gradually imposed as a legitimate and essential issue for CBs to consider, provides an overview actual practices across the global central banking community and offers recommendation for CBs at different stages.

title: Opportunities in credit for public pensions
abstract: Explore insights into the role of credit for corporate and public pensions in a low yield environment and opportunities for yield, return and diversification.

title: Opportunities in credit for corporate pensions
abstract: Explore insights into the role of credit for corporate and public pensions in a low yield environment and opportunities for yield, return and diversification.

title: Navigating a new era of tax policy 2021
abstract: In this blog, we will discuss how the upcoming changes to US tax policy and tax advantage solutions will impact family offices.

title: ESG education for endowments and foundations
abstract: Incorporating sustainability can help endowments and foundations identify investment risks, generate excess return and create more resilient portfolios. In this training, we explore opportunities and solutions in ESG investing.

title: Our outlook on commodities and ESG integration
abstract: Commodity prices benefitted from the global economic restart after the pandemic pause. Going forward we believe ESG will be a core component of the investment process as a risk and opportunity.

title: A new era of portfolio construction for endowments
abstract: BlackRock examines how the endowment model has performed and offers insight on how E&Fs can improve their investing, risk management and portfolio construction.

title: Q1 2021 OIG digest
abstract: Markets in 2021 have entered the post-pandemic era, with global equities are hovering near all-time highs and market anxiety now driven by rising interest rates. Read more in our first Official Institutions quarterly digest of the year.

title: Key investment themes for family offices in 2021‌
abstract: In this start-of-the-year blog, we discuss investment themes driving markets in 2021, tactical asset allocation ideas and where we see opportunities for family office investors.

title: The evolution of sustainable investing for family offices
abstract: Family offices have moved from learning about sustainable investing to incorporating it. Explore how we're seeing family offices engaging in climate and impact strategies.

title: Q1 2021 Emerging Markets Outlook
abstract: The bullish case for emerging markets is not history. For both EM equity and fixed income, 2021 is likely to be a tale of two parts –a strenuous beginning to the year and a potentially brighter finish.

title: Adding diversified global credit to U.S. public pensions
abstract: Global public credit markets have grown significantly in the last decade. We analyzed the average asset allocation of U.S. public pension plans and the impact of adding credit to portfolios.

title: Adding diversified global credit to U.S. corporate pensions
abstract: Global credit has grown into an asset class that can assist in generating income and dampening volatility. We analyzed the average asset allocation of the largest 100 U.S. corporate pension plans and the impact of adding credit to portfolios.

title: LDI in a rising rate environment
abstract: How have corporate pensions been responding to rising rates, and how should we think about LDI in a rising rate world?

title: Real Assets in Reserve Portfolios
abstract: As bond yields are expected to remain low, investors with gov't bond denominated portfolios are considering expanding their investment universe. We explore in this piece the role that commodities could play in portfolio construction.

title: Is sustained higher inflation on the cards?
abstract: The prospect of sustained higher inflation is at the heart of market debates in 2021. Read more about what our experts think is to come, and how it is impacting portfolio positioning.

title: Global family office survey
abstract: The BlackRock global family office survey combines data about the experiences and plans of 185 family offices across the globe, featuring insights around market outlook, asset allocation and sustainable investing.

title: OIG Q4 digest
abstract: As one of the most challenging years on record comes to a close, we've rounded up the key trends and themes currently shaping the Official Institutions investing landscape - as well as highlighting some of our insights on what we think 2021 holds.

title: An endowment’s perspective on the outsourced CIO model
abstract: Jeff Mindlin, CIO of ASU Enterprise Partners, sat down with Mark McCombe, BlackRock’s Chief Client Officer, to discuss how endowments can build a successful OCIO partnership.

title: Integrating sustainability into capital market assumptions
abstract: Ahead of BlackRock’s forthcoming launch of new CMAs that will integrate sustainability for the first time, we gathered BlackRock thought leaders to discuss the framework and importance of incorporating ESG considerations into portfolio construction.

title: Public pensions in the 2020s: Planning for a different decade ahead
abstract: BlackRock analyzed fund-level data for nearly 70 public pensions to gauge how likely they are to meet their return assumptions over the next decade.

title: Family Office Virtual Summit: Collective Intelligence
abstract: The BlackRock Family Office Virtual Summit hosted 450 clients from the US, Canada, LatAm and EMEA, providing an agenda oriented around networking and BlackRock’s collective intelligence. For more, visit the event hub.

title: Global Insurance Report 2020
abstract: 360 senior insurance executives across the globe share their insights into how the pandemic is fundamentally reshaping the industry and their investment approach in BlackRock's ninth annual global insurance survey.

title: OIG Q3 digest
abstract: Entering the final stretch of a challenging year for investors, we review OI key themes and trends, and discuss what's to come next.

title: Impact of recent market volatility on corporate pensions
abstract: We examine the impact of recent volatility on the funded status, asset allocations and active risk of U.S. corporate pensions.

title: Key themes for corporate plans after Q1 volatility
abstract: BlackRock has updated its 2020 investment themes for corporate pension plans given the sharp declines in equity markets and risk assets around the world.

title: Impact of recent market volatility on public pensions
abstract: We assess how market volatility has impacted funded status and altered asset allocations at U.S. public pension plans.

title: A guide to DC loans during turmoil
abstract: What to tell participants about borrowing from their DC plans during market volatility.

title: Three actions for plan sponsors
abstract: Helping participants mitigate market volatility is crucial to protecting their retirement accounts.

title: Impact of coronavirus on central banks
abstract: Q&A with Stanley Fischer on how central banks should react to the coronavirus shock.

title: How smaller endowments make do
abstract: OCIO partnerships have the potential to help smaller endowments diversify their investing strategies to better deliver against their outcomes.

title: Take advantage of the SECURE Act
abstract: Barbara Novick, BlackRock’s Vice Chairman and head of the Global Public Policy Group, called the SECURE Act “our greatest opportunity in over a decade to improve retirement security for millions of Americans.

title: A climate scenario analysis of US insurers’ portfolios
abstract: Here’s how investors can better understand climate risks and adapt investment strategies to manage them.

title: Raising resilience in strategic portfolios
abstract: In our view, we believe it’s crucial to consider explicitly the uncertainty inherent in return estimates when building resilient portfolios.

title: Sourcing resilience in fixed income
abstract: BlackRock Description: We identify six themes that we believe are critical in helping to build those more resilient portfolios.

title: Portfolio resilience through sustainability
abstract: We explore how insurers can enhance their resilience to climate change from both a physical and transition risk perspective, with data and scenario analysis as the common thread.

title: Insurance portfolio construction for alternatives
abstract: Insurer's complex liability profiles and regulatory and accounting constraints create additional portfolio construction considerations.

title: Global Insurance Report 2019: Re-engineering portfolio resilience
abstract: BlackRock’s eighth annual global insurance survey provides perspectives on markets and portfolio construction from 360 senior insurance executives, plus client interviews and insights from BlackRock’s experts.

title: Positioning for net zero
abstract: The transition towards a decarbonized economy is underway. Read our take on how clients can position their portfolios now for that economic transformation.

title: Addressing climate change in sovereign bond portfolios
abstract: Sovereign bonds play an important role in building balanced portfolios. They also provide an opportunity to help transition toward net zero if investors actively seek to reduce carbon emissions within their sovereign bond allocations.

title: How the Paris Agreement is shaping equity investing
abstract: The 2015 Paris Agreement sets a global standard for preventing climate change. Learn how it’s changing the way equity investors uncover alpha today.

title: How to finance the net-zero transition in emerging markets
abstract: Countries have a stake in avoiding mounting climate risk, but emerging markets will play a key role in the net-zero transition. Dive deeper in this featured insight from the BlackRock Investment Institute.

title: A world in transition
abstract: We convened today’s top minds - including John Kerry, Ray Dalio and Rick Rieder - to examine a world emerging from crisis and themes shaping the course for policy, global markets and investors. Explore the BlackRock Future Forum on-demand content.

title: A new world of renewables: Part II
abstract: Read part two of ‘A new world of renewables’, which takes a closer look at emerging market trends and opportunities for renewable power investments.

title: A multi-asset approach to navigating net zero
abstract: In this featured insight, we focus on the practical implications of moving from climate pledges to practice for multi-asset investors by sharing our preferred framework.

title: Global Impact Annual Report
abstract: Our report captures the reality of the challenges we face amid the ongoing global pandemic as well as the resilient responses that many impact enterprises offer as solutions. Explore more in BlackRock’s inaugural Global Impact Annual Report.

title: Q2 2021 OIG digest
abstract: As we close out the first half of 2021, investors are becoming increasingly concerned over inflation and the delta variant, while sustainability remains top of mind for global official institutions. Read more about our outlook and key trends.

title: Integrating the UN SDGs in investments
abstract: We explore how the UN SDGs can be viewed through the lens of financial materiality and used for building strategies that invest in the transition towards a more sustainable and equitable world.

title: Impact investing in public equities
abstract: Impact investing in public equities can help accomplish two objectives: generate financial outperformance and provide a differentiated source of alpha. Read more in our report.

title: Trickle to main stream - Central banks’ journey into sustainability
abstract: This paper examines how climate change gradually imposed as a legitimate and essential issue for CBs to consider, provides an overview actual practices across the global central banking community and offers recommendation for CBs at different stages.

title: A new world of renewables: Part I
abstract: Read part one of ‘A new world of renewables’, which assesses the context, opportunities and priorities in emerging markets for renewable power investments.

title: Portfolio approaches to net zero
abstract: Read an overview of the different approaches available to transition an equity portfolio to net zero alignment, focusing on carbon intensity and risk factors.

title: Sustainability at the portfolio level
abstract: We analyze the impact of allocating to sustainable investments on the return, risk and ESG profile at the whole portfolio level.

title: The tectonic shift to sustainable investing
abstract: Three powerful forces are converging to drive a long-term trend in favor of sustainable assets. Investors positioned for the shift now stand to benefit.

title: Sustainability: The path to net zero
abstract: Explore on-demand content from our BlackRock Future Forum Sustainability special: The path to net zero, where industry leaders weighed in on carbon neutrality and innovation.

title: Invest with impact
abstract: Our paper supports impact investing in public equities by reference to additionality through the investor’s contribution, the investee, and the asset class.

title: Delivering outcomes by accessing ESG
abstract: We outline our belief that incorporating ESG insights can improve investment outcome. This can be done through our index, factor, and alpha framework.

title: The evolution of sustainable investing for family offices
abstract: Family offices have moved from learning about sustainable investing to incorporating it. Explore how we're seeing family offices engaging in climate and impact strategies.

title: Launching climate-aware portfolios
abstract: We believe climate risk is investment risk. That is why we are incorporating it into our portfolio design, as part of a series of actions BlackRock is taking to prepare for a net-zero world.

title: Turning risk into opportunity
abstract: Read our in-depth paper exploring how we incorporate climate change into our portfolio design - one step in a series of actions BlackRock is taking to prepare for a net-zero world.

title: ESG moves centre stage in private debt
abstract: Private debt strategies can work with borrowers on ESG issues. Sonia Richer, Head of Research for European Middle Market Private Debt, explains how.

title: Integrating sustainability into capital market assumptions
abstract: Ahead of BlackRock’s forthcoming launch of new CMAs that will integrate sustainability for the first time, we gathered BlackRock thought leaders to discuss the framework and importance of incorporating ESG considerations into portfolio construction.

title: Addressing investment stewardship and the ‘G’ in ESG
abstract: We share perspectives on Investment Stewardship, the G in ESG, and how they can help drive long-term sustainable value for investors.

title: Sustainability goes mainstream
abstract: BlackRock recently surveyed clients around the world to understand the shift towards sustainable assets and how the pandemic may affect it. Our findings were clear: The tectonic shift towards sustainable investing is accelerating.

title: Helping our clients invest sustainably
abstract: Our survey revealed that sustainability considerations are increasingly becoming a central aspect of our clients’ investment approaches. Read our update on our 2020 sustainability progress.

title: Physical Effects & Economic Risks of Climate Change
abstract: We discuss the increasing importance of the environmental component of ESG in the era of climate change.

title: Rethinking the ‘S’ in ESG
abstract: BlackRock and CalPERS discuss the increasing importance of ESG and sustainability more broadly, in this time of upheaval.

title: Sustainable investing: active equities
abstract: Sustainable investing is going mainstream. The Systematic Active Equity team discusses the need to dig beyond headline numbers.

title: The renewable revolution
abstract: A look at how the world will power its energy needs in the future and where structural transformation is leading to investment opportunities.

title: Shining a spotlight on the stakeholder
abstract: Hear from investors about how they are addressing the rising prominence of issues that impact employees, customers and communities the most with sustainable investing in order to drive change.

title: Winds of change: How to invest in renewables today
abstract: We explore how to invest in renewables today as well as the role of this asset class in a total portfolio.

title: Troubled waters
abstract: What would the world look like with less water? We explore the often overlooked risk of water stress and its financial implications on portfolios. Take a look.

title: Sustainable Investing: Why it matters now more than ever
abstract: We examine the investment opportunities that ESG is creating and take a look at the latest trends in impact investing.

title: Accelerating sustainability in alternatives
abstract: Sustainability factors are even more important in long-term private investments—a point that COVID is underlining.

title: A pivotal moment for sustainable investing
abstract: How ESG strategies have performed during the pandemic and why they will become increasingly important in the future.

title: Resilience amid uncertainty
abstract: Amid historic volatility, investors turned to sustainable strategies, and the strategies demonstrated their resilience.

title: Helping our clients invest sustainably
abstract: BlackRock discusses its progress since committing to help clients achieve their sustainable investing goals. Learn more.

title: Renewables are proving resilient
abstract: How well-structured deals and the ongoing global energy transition can benefit wind and solar investments in the current downturn.

title: Securities lending viewed through the sustainability lens
abstract: In this Spotlight, we explore the intersection of securities lending with short selling and investment stewardship through the lens of sustainable investing.

title: How a global pandemic could accelerate ESG investing
abstract: Tony DeSpirito discusses its potential impact on ESG investing and how it may hasten an important trend for active investors.

title: Sustainability: The tectonic shift transforming investing
abstract: A commonly held view is that a return sacrifice is needed when adopting sustainable investing. We disagree – and in fact believe the opposite is true.

title: Europe’s listed companies: their governance, shareholders and votes
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we analyze the ownership of companies in the MSCI Europe index and examined the proxy voting of their 30 largest institutional shareholders.

title: Towards a common language for sustainable investing *VP
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we review current global regulatory efforts to develop and implement more standardized terminology for sustainable investing, and we outline recommendations to increase clarity around (i) sustainable investment product

title: A climate scenario analysis of US insurers’ portfolios
abstract: A climate scenario analysis on US insurers’ portfolios can help investors understand climate risks and adapt investment strategies to manage them.

title: Sustainability: The bond that endures
abstract: Evidence is building that a focus on sustainability can help investors build more resilient portfolios.

title: Long-term savings and retirement in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
abstract: In this Spotlight, we draw on case studies of pension system reform around the world, and examine the demographic transformation informing retirement policy considerations in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: Regulatory developments in Europe: 2021 overview
abstract: This ViewPoint summarises the key financial services policy developments impacting retail investors, institutional investors, and distributors in Europe.

title: The endgame: Benchmark reform and transition from LIBORs
abstract: This ViewPoint focuses on providing an update on LIBOR transition, information and recommendations on outstanding issues, and what to expect next as we move closer to LIBOR cessation.

title: By the numbers: New data behind the bond ETF primary process
abstract: Our report features never-before-released data on the characteristics of iShares bond ETF redemption basket data, with insights into the importance of a robust primary market process and the role it plays in maintaining the bond ETF ecosystem.

title: Liquidity risk management is central to open-ended funds
abstract: This ViewPoint explores the lessons from COVID-19 with a focus on liquidity risk management and its centrality to open-ended funds.

title: Asset managers of scale give voice to investors and economic support
abstract: This ViewPoint reviews how large asset managers — those that operate at scale, with a diverse client base and a long term orientation — offer value to investors, businesses, and society.

title: Authorized Participants
abstract: This Spotlight examines the role of APs in ETF markets. It specifically examines their role and resilience during the March 2020 market events. APs' breadth and size should alleviate concerns that ETFs rely on too few APs.

title: Market structure and the interconnectedness of financial markets
abstract: In this ‘Lessons from COVID-19’ ViewPoint, we discuss the evolving market ecosystem and examine how market infrastructure contributed to the short lived but intense liquidity crisis of March 2020.

title: Liquidity risk management is central to open-ended funds
abstract: In this “Lessons from COVID-19’ ViewPoint, we examine the effect of stressed markets on open-ended funds and bond funds. We then review the liquidity risk management tools available to asset managers, and how they were deployed during March 2020.

title: Swing pricing: The effects of investor trading on mutual funds
abstract: This paper considers processes that provide protection to existing mutual fund investors from the negative ‘dilution impact’ that occurs when a fund invests or disinvests in securities as a result of investor activity.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: Operational risk and resilience
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we analyze operational challenges faced by the asset management industry during COVID-19, explore how the industry responded to these challenges, and outline a series of recommendations to further bolster operational resilience.

title: Overview of financial stability and non-bank financial institutions
abstract: This ViewPoint summarizes key takeaways from our series of ViewPoints on "Lessons from COVID-19", considers the implications of the COVID-19 crisis across capital markets, and outlines policy recommendations.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: U.S. BBB bonds and fallen angels
abstract: We provide an update to our August 2019 spotlight on US BBB Bonds in light of the first broad credit downgrade cycle resulting from COVID-19 and lower oil prices.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: Fixed income index rebalancing
abstract: We discuss how decisions to delay fixed income index rebalancing during March 2020 helped to preserve market liquidity, prevent unnecessarily large transaction costs for end-investors, and more.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: The experience of European MMFs
abstract: We make a holistic assessment of European short-term markets during the March market turmoil and identify three key components of the short-term market ecosystem.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: U.S. municipal bond market
abstract: We explore aspects of the U.S. municipal bond market ecosystem during the COVID-19 Crisis, the Federal response to provide assistance to municipalities, and liquidity risk management of municipal bond funds.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: U.S. short-term money markets
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we make a holistic assessment of U.S. short-term markets during the March market turmoil and identify three key components of the short-term market ecosystem.

title: Lessons from COVID-19: ETFs as a source of stability
abstract: We explore how ETFs were a source of stability during the first part of 2020 amidst unprecedented market volatility by providing price transparency and liquidity.

title: A global perspective on market on close activity
abstract: This ViewPoint explores the growth of global market-on-close activity, the key drivers behind this trend, and the benefits that the closing auction provides.

title: Improving investment outcomes for 403(b) plan participants
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we highlight a relatively easy step policy makers can take that would expand choice for 403(b) plan sponsors in selecting investment vehicles and could result in cost savings for plan participants.

title: BlackRock's Guide to LIBOR Transition
abstract: This ViewPoint focuses on providing an update on LIBOR transition, information on upcoming milestones, BlackRock’s transition planning, and other information to serve as a reference and guide for clients, industry participants, and stakeholders.

title: Securities lending viewed through the sustainability lens
abstract: In this Spotlight, we explore the intersection of securities lending with short selling and investment stewardship through the lens of sustainable investing.

title: Regulatory developments in Europe: 2020 outlook
abstract: This ViewPoint summarises the key financial services policy developments impacting European retail investors, institutional investors, and distributors.

title: Europe's listed companies
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we analyze the ownership of companies in the MSCI Europe index and examined the proxy voting of their 30 largest institutional shareholders.

title: Towards a common language for sustainable investing
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we review current global regulatory efforts to develop and implement more standardized terminology for sustainable investing.

title: The decade of financial regulatory reform: 2009 to 2019
abstract: In this ViewPoint, we examine financial regulatory reforms over the past decade, with a focus on the asset management sector. In addition, we look ahead and identify several areas that merit additional study from a systemic risk perspective.
